what: Regularized cause-specific cox and absolute risk predictions
title: CSCNet vignette
text: package use Melanoma data ‘riskRegression’ package (load ‘CSCNet’) start loading package Melanoma data. 2 events Melanoma data coded 1 & 2. introduce setting variables hyper-parameters works CSCNet, fit model following hyper-parameters Melanoma data: (α1,α2,λ1,λ2)=(0,0.5,0.01,0.02)(\alpha_{1},\alpha_{2},\lambda_{1},\lambda_{2})=(0,0.5,0.01,0.02) set variables affecting event: 1 age,sex,invasion,thick variables affecting event: 2 age,sex,epicel,ici,thick.
code: library(CSCNet) library(riskRegression) data(Melanoma) as_tibble(Melanoma)  [38;5;246m# A tibble: 205 × 11 [39m     time status event     invasion ici   epicel ulcer thick sex     age logthick     [3m [38;5;246m<int> [39m [23m   [3m [38;5;246m<dbl> [39m [23m  [3m [38;5;246m<fct> [39m [23m      [3m [38;5;246m<fct> [39m [23m     [3m [38;5;246m<fct> [39m [23m  [3m [38;5;246m<fct> [39m [23m   [3m [38;5;246m<fct> [39m [23m  [3m [38;5;246m<dbl> [39m [23m  [3m [38;5;246m<fct> [39m [23m  [3m [38;5;246m<int> [39m [23m     [3m [38;5;246m<dbl> [39m [23m  [38;5;250m 1 [39m    10      2 death.ot… level.1  2     prese… pres…  6.76 Male     76    1.91   [38;5;250m 2 [39m    30      2 death.ot… level.0  0     not p… not …  0.65 Male     56   - [31m0 [39m [31m. [39m [31m431 [39m  [38;5;250m 3 [39m    35      0 censored  level.1  2     not p… not …  1.34 Male     41    0.293  [38;5;250m 4 [39m    99      2 death.ot… level.0  2     not p… not …  2.9  Fema…    71    1.06   [38;5;250m 5 [39m   185      1 death.ma… level.2  2     prese… pres… 12.1  Male     52    2.49   [38;5;250m 6 [39m   204      1 death.ma… level.2  2     not p… pres…  4.84 Male     28    1.58   [38;5;250m 7 [39m   210      1 death.ma… level.2  2     prese… pres…  5.16 Male     77    1.64   [38;5;250m 8 [39m   232      1 death.ma… level.2  2     not p… pres… 12.9  Male     49    2.56   [38;5;250m 9 [39m   232      2 death.ot… level.1  3     not p… pres…  3.22 Fema…    60    1.17   [38;5;250m10 [39m   279      1 death.ma… level.0  2     not p… pres…  7.41 Fema…    68    2.00   [38;5;246m# ℹ 195 more rows [39m table(Melanoma$status)    0   1   2  134  57  14

previous_headings: Regularized cause-specific cox and absolute risk predictions
title: CSCNet vignette
text: CSCNet, setting variables hyper-parameters done named lists. Variables hyper-parameters related involved cause stored list positions name position cause. course names must values status variable data. penfit comprehensive list information related data fitted models detail user can access. Note: saw, variable specification vars.list possible 2 ways introducing vector variable names one hand sided formula different causes.
code: vl <- list('1'=c('age','sex','invasion','thick'),            '2'=~age+sex+epicel+ici+thick)  penfit <- penCSC(time = 'time',                                    status = 'status',                                    vars.list = vl,                                    data = Melanoma,                                    alpha.list = list('1'=0,'2'=.5),                                    lambda.list = list('1'=.01,'2'=.02))  penfit $`Event: 1` 5 x 1 sparse Matrix of class "dgCMatrix"                           1 age             0.008018578 sexMale         0.547580959 invasionlevel.1 0.756922406 invasionlevel.2 0.591044240 thick           0.118568171  $`Event: 2` 7 x 1 sparse Matrix of class "dgCMatrix"                         1 age            0.04839997 sexMale        0.11419057 epicelpresent  0.16891622 ici1          -0.13501846 ici2           .          ici3           .          thick          0.03242932

previous_headings: Regularized cause-specific cox and absolute risk predictions
what: Predictions and semi-parametric estimates of absolute risk
title: CSCNet vignette
text: Now obtain predictions, specially estimates absolute risks, predict.penCSC method developed user can obtain different forms values easiest way possible. method objects class penCSCS different involved causes, user can obtain values linear predictors (type='lp' type='link'), exponential linear predictors (type='risk' type='response') finally semi-parametric estimates absolute risks (type='absRisk') desired time horizons. Note: Default value event argument predict.penCSC NULL. user leaves , values involved causes returned. Values linear predictors event: 1 related 1st five individuals data: risk values individuals involved causes: Now let’s say want estimates absolute risks related event: 1 event interest 3 5 year time horizons: Note: ’s also predictRisk.penCSC obtain absolute risk predictions. method developed compatibility tools ‘riskRegression’ package.

title: CSCNet vignette
text: example illustration purposes. real world analysis, one must tune hyper-parameters respect proper loss function resampling procedures. tune_penCSC comprehensive function built purpose regularized cause-specific cox models. Like , specification variables hyper-parameters done named lists sequences candidate hyper-parameters related involved cause stored list positions name position cause. , tune_penCSC create possible combinations user’s specified sequences evaluates using either IPCW brier score IPCW AUC (loss functions) based absolute risk predictions event interest (linking) chosen resampling process. Supported resampling procedures : cross validation (method='cv'), repeated cross validation (method='repcv'), bootstrap (method='boot'), Monte-Carlo leave group cross validation (method='lgocv') leave one cross validation (method='loocv').

title: CSCNet vignette
text: tune_penCSC ability automatically determine candidate sequences α\alpha & λ\lambda values. Setting alpha.grid & lambda.grid NULL order function calculate automatically. automatic sequence α\alpha values causes seq(0,1,.5), process determining λ\lambda values automatically : algorithm fits LASSO models finding λ\lambda value creates NULL model variables shrunk exactly 0. path reach maximum λ\lambda specified internally glmnet. obtained λ\lambda value used maximum value sequence starting 0. length sequence controlled values nlambdas.list. done cause-specific model create exclusive sequences λ\lambdas .

title: CSCNet vignette
text: data requires pre-processing steps, must done within resampling process avoid data leakage. can achieved using preProc.fun argument tune_penCSC function. arguments accepts function data input returns modified version data. pre-processing steps can specified within function. Note: tune_penCSC parallel processing option. user specified function pre-processing steps global objects calls packages wants run code parallel, names extra packages global objects must given preProc.pkgs preProc.globals. Now let’s see mentioned section example. Let’s say want tune model 5 year absolute risk prediction event: 1 based time dependent (IPCW) AUC loss function (evaluation metric) 5-fold cross validation process:
code: #A pre-processing function that removes (near) zero-variance predictors  library('collinear')  zvr.fun <- function(data){    zv_vars <- identify_zero_variance_variables(df = data,responses = c('time','status'))    return(data %>% select(-all_of(zv_vars)))  }  #Tuning a regularized cause-specific Cox model  tune_melanoma <- tune_penCSC(time = 'time',                                                            status = 'status',                                                            vars.list = vl,                                                            data = Melanoma,                                                            horizons = 365*3,                                                            event = 1,                                                            method = 'cv',                                                            k = 3,                                                            metrics = 'AUC',                                                            alpha.grid = list('1'=0,'2'=c(.5,1)),                                                            preProc.fun = zvr.fun,                                                            parallel = TRUE,                                                            preProc.pkgs = 'collinear')  Process was done in 18.86663 secs.  tune_melanoma$validation_result %>% arrange(desc(mean.AUC)) %>% head   alpha_1 alpha_2 lambda_1 lambda_2 horizon  mean.AUC 1       0     1.0   0.1700   0.0700    1095 0.7025575 2       0     1.0   0.1700   0.0525    1095 0.7024615 3       0     0.5   0.1700   0.0700    1095 0.7001096 4       0     1.0   0.1700   0.0350    1095 0.6994490 5       0     0.5   0.1700   0.0525    1095 0.6976188 6       0     1.0   0.1275   0.0525    1095 0.6959906  tune_melanoma$final_params $`1095`   alpha_1 alpha_2 lambda_1 lambda_2 horizon  mean.AUC 1       0       1     0.17     0.07    1095 0.7025575  tune_melanoma$final_fits $`1095` $`Event: 1` 5 x 1 sparse Matrix of class "dgCMatrix"                           1 age             0.006944353 sexMale         0.367007346 invasionlevel.1 0.436418373 invasionlevel.2 0.360945728 thick           0.096901626  $`Event: 2` 7 x 1 sparse Matrix of class "dgCMatrix"               1 age           . sexMale       . epicelpresent . ici1          . ici2          . ici3          . thick         .

title: Authors and Citation
text: Shahin Roshani. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Roshani S (2026). CSCNet: Fitting Tuning Regularized Cause-Specific Cox Models Elastic-Net Penalty. R package version 0.1.3, https://shahin-roshani.github.io/CSCNet/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {CSCNet: Fitting and Tuning Regularized Cause-Specific Cox Models with Elastic-Net Penalty},   author = {Shahin Roshani},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.3},   url = {https://shahin-roshani.github.io/CSCNet/}, }

what: Fitting and Tuning Regularized Cause-Specific Cox Models with Elastic-Net Penalty
title: Fitting and Tuning Regularized Cause-Specific Cox Models with Elastic-Net Penalty
text: Flexible tools fitting, tuning obtaining absolute risk predictions regularized cause-specific cox (CSC) models elastic-net penalty.

title: Fitting and Tuning Regularized Cause-Specific Cox Models with Elastic-Net Penalty
text: can install latest version CSCNet CRAN GitHub:
code: #CRAN  install.packages('CSCNet')  #GitHub  install.packages('devtools') #If you haven't installed it yet!  devtools::install_github('Shahin-Roshani/CSCNet')

title: penCSC — penCSC
text: Function fit penalized cause-specific-cox elastic-net penalty.

title: penCSC — penCSC
code: penCSC(   time,   status,   vars.list,   data,   alpha.list,   lambda.list,   standardize = TRUE,   keep = NULL )

title: penCSC — penCSC
text: time character showing name time variable data. status character showing name status/event variable data. vars.list named list containing variables included cause-specific model. Variables can vectors variable names one sided formula. Names list must events exactly values status variable. See `Examples` details. data data frame containing information variables. alpha.list named list containing single alpha values cause-specific model. Names list must events exactly values status variable. See `Examples` details. lambda.list named list containing single lambda values cause-specific model. Names list must events exactly values status variable. See `Examples` details. standardize Logical indicating whether variables must standardized . Default TRUE. keep character vector names variables shrunk. Default NULL.

title: penCSC — penCSC
text: named list containing information related used data fitted models causes. Use $ explore involved information.

title: penCSC — penCSC
text: Friedman J, Hastie T, Tibshirani R (2010). "Regularization Paths Generalized Linear Models via Coordinate Descent." Journal Statistical Software, 33(1), 1-22. doi:10.18637/jss.v033.i01 , https://www.jstatsoft.org/v33/i01/. Therneau T (2022). Package Survival Analysis R. R package version 3.3-1, https://CRAN.R-project.org/package=survival. Wickham H, Averick M, Bryan J, Chang W, McGowan L, François R, et al. Welcome tidyverse. J Open Source Softw. 2019 Nov 21;4(43):1686. Bache S, Wickham H (2022). magrittr: Forward-Pipe Operator R. https://magrittr.tidyverse.org, https://github.com/tidyverse/magrittr.

title: penCSC — penCSC

title: predict.penCSC — predict.penCSC
text: object object class `penCSC`. newX data frame containing information variables related new records. Information variables included model creation ignored. event vector event codes want predictions . must values status variable data used create models. NULL, absolute risk calculated involved events. Default NULL returns values involved causes. time vector time horizons want absolute risk predictions . applicable type='absRisk'. type Type predictions. Valid values : 'lp' 'link' linear predictors, 'risk' 'response' exp(lp) finally 'absRisk' semi-parametric estimates absolute risk. reference Reference centering predictions. Valid values 'zero' 'sample'. Default 'zero'. information referencing see details ?predict.coxph. ... Additional arguments. used predict.penCSC.

title: predictRisk.penCSC — predictRisk.penCSC
code: library(riskRegression)  data(Melanoma)  vl <- list('1'=c('age','sex','ulcer','thick'),            '2'=~age+sex+epicel+thick+ici)  al <- list('1'=0,'2'=.5)  ll <- list('1'=.01,'2'=.04)  penfit <- penCSC(time='time',status='status',vars.list=vl,                  data=Melanoma,alpha.list=al,lambda.list=ll)  predictRisk(penfit,Melanoma[1:5,],times=1825*(1:2),cause=1) #>           1825      3650 #> [1,] 0.5989514 0.7634726 #> [2,] 0.1245976 0.2072521 #> [3,] 0.1147573 0.1931740 #> [4,] 0.1213908 0.1996565 #> [5,] 0.7199651 0.8683818

title: tune_penCSC — tune_penCSC
code: tune_penCSC(   time,   status,   vars.list,   data,   horizons,   event,   rhs = ~1,   method = "cv",   k = 10,   times = 25,   p = 0.7,   strat.var = NULL,   metrics = "Brier",   final.metric = NULL,   alpha.grid = NULL,   lambda.grid = NULL,   nlambdas.list = NULL,   grow.by = NULL,   standardize = TRUE,   keep = NULL,   preProc.fun = function(x) x,   preProc.fun.test = NULL,   parallel = FALSE,   preProc.pkgs = NULL,   preProc.globals = NULL,   core.nums = parallelly::availableCores()/2 )

title: tune_penCSC — tune_penCSC
text: time character showing name time variable data. status character showing name status/event variable data. vars.list named list containing variables included cause-specific model. Variables can vectors variable names one sided formula. Names list must events exactly values status variable. See `Examples` details. data data frame containing information variables. horizons vector time horizons want absolute risk predictions evaluated . event value event interest want absolute risk predictions evaluated . must one values status variable data. rhs right hand sided formula indicating variables used estimating inverse probability censoring weighting (IPCW) model. Default ~1. method Resampling method used hyper-parameter tuning. Values can : 'cv' cross validation, 'repcv' repeated cross validation, 'lgocv' monte-carlo cross validation, 'loocv' leave one cross validation 'boot' bootstrap. Default 'cv'. k Number folds. applicable method='cv' method='repcv'. Default 10. times Repeat number resampling process. applicable method='repcv', method='lgocv' method='boot'. Default 25. p fraction data used training set resampling. applicable method='lgocv'. Default 0.7. strat.var single character indicating name strata variable used create resamples. numerical, groups specified based percentiles. Default NULL considers status variable factor creates resamples based different levels . metrics Evaluation metric (loss function) used. Values can 'Brier' IPCW brier score, 'AUC' IPCW AUC vector . Default 'Brier'. final.metric evaluation metric decide best hyper-parameters set final fits whole data. NULL default value, takes value metrics. 'Brier' 'AUC' specified metrics final.metric NULL, 'Brier' used. alpha.grid named list containing sequence alpha values evaluated cause-specific model. Names list must events exactly values status variable. Default NULL orders function set seq(0,1,.5) cause-specific models. See `Details` information. lambda.grid named list containing sequence lambda values evaluated cause-specific model. Names list must events exactly values status variable. Default NULL orders function calculate exclusive lambda sequences causes. See `Details` information. nlambdas.list names list single integers indicating length lambda sequences calculated automatically function cause. applicable lambda.grid=NULL. Default NULL sets lengths 5. See `Details` information. grow.Difference values growing sequence lambda values find maximum value makes null model. applicable lambda.grid=NULL. Default 0.01. See `Details` information. standardize Logical indicating whether variables must standardized model fitting procedures. Default TRUE. keep character vector names variables shrunk model fitting procedures. Default NULL. preProc.fun function accepts data returns modified version gone user's desired pre-processing steps. modifications function done resampling procedures avoid data leakage. modify training test set(s) validation unless argument preProc.fun.test specified user affects training set(s). Default function(x) x. Also see description preProc.fun.test argument. preProc.fun.test function exact characteristics description preProc.fun argument. user specifies separate function preProc.fun.test, affect test set(s) validation function preProc.fun affect training set(s). Default NULL means function preProc.fun used training test set(s) validation. Also see description preProc.fun argument. parallel Logical indicating whether tuning process performed parallel . Default FALSE. preProc.pkgs character vector containing names packages used creating user's preProc.fun using parallel computation. applicable parallel=T preProc.fun user specified function using functions packages. See 'Examples' details. preProc.globals character vector containing names objects included preProc.fun considered global objects using parallel computation. frequent ones names user specified pre processing function functions within function. applicable parallel=T preProc.fun user specified function. See 'Examples' details. core.nums Number CPU cores used parallel computation. applicable parallel=T. Default parallelly::availableCores()/2.

title: tune_penCSC — tune_penCSC
text: list containing detailed information hyper-parameter tuning validation process, best combination hyper-parameters final fits based whole data using best obtained hyper-parameters. Use $ explore involved information.

title: tune_penCSC — tune_penCSC
text: tune_penCSC ability automatically determine candidate sequences alpha & lambda values. Setting alpha.grid & lambda.grid NULL order function calculate automatically. process determining lambda values automatically : Starting lambda=0, algorithm fits LASSO models finding lambda value creates NULL model variables shrunk exactly zero. obtained lambda value used maximum value sequence starting 0. length sequence controlled values nlambdas.list. done cause-specific model create exclusive sequences lambdas .

title: tune_penCSC — tune_penCSC
text: Shahin Roshani

title: tune_penCSC — tune_penCSC
code: # \donttest{  library(riskRegression)  data(Melanoma)  vl <- list('1'=~age+sex+epicel+ici,            '2'=c('age','ulcer','thick','invasion'))  al <- list('1'=0,'2'=c(.5,1))  #External function that removes (near) zero-variance predictors  library('collinear')  zvr.fun <- function(data){   zv_vars <- identify_zero_variance_variables(df = data,responses = c('time','status'))   return(data %>% select(-all_of(zv_vars)))  }  test <- tune_penCSC(time='time',status='status',vars.list=vl,data=Melanoma,horizons=1095,                     event=1,method='cv',k=3,metrics='AUC',alpha.grid=al,standardize=TRUE,                     preProc.fun=zvr.fun,parallel=TRUE,preProc.pkgs='collinear') #>  #> Process was done in 17.07098 secs.  test #> $`1095` #> $`Event: 1` #> 6 x 1 sparse Matrix of class "dgCMatrix" #>                         1 #> age            0.02248578 #> sexMale        0.79689504 #> epicelpresent -1.10991986 #> ici1           1.77593118 #> ici2           1.87392279 #> ici3           2.55198560 #>  #> $`Event: 2` #> 5 x 1 sparse Matrix of class "dgCMatrix" #>                           1 #> age              0.05357151 #> ulcerpresent     0.01476397 #> thick            0.06236775 #> invasionlevel.1 -0.19839193 #> invasionlevel.2 -0.52400890 #>  #>   # }

title: CSCNet 0.1.3
text: tune_penCSC: Fixed issue function worked survival outcome included censoring. grow.deprecated scheduled removal future version. paths reach maximum lambdas now specified glmnet. Function now correctly sets multisession plan parallel computations.

title: CSCNet 0.1.2
text: CRAN release: 2022-11-08 penCSC: Added call results list. predict.penCSC: Corrected issue newdata include variables data setting matching factor levels characters newdata. tune_penCSC: Corrected issue keep & standardize arguments affecting $final_fits result.
